name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Island Palms Hotel & Marina

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights - from 3/22 through 3/26/07 - at the Best Western Island Palms. We called the hotel directly for the reservation and obtained a $99.50 nightly rate using the Entertainment Book discount. Upon checking into the hotel we were upgraded to a suite, and what a lovely suite it was!
reviews.title: Loved the Island Palms, not the ducks!

reviews.text: Our suite had a full kitchen, living room with pull-out couch, large bathroom and bedroom, plus a good-sized patio with table and chairs overlooking the marina. Others in our party were not so lucky and had a regular room. With 2 queen-sized beds, the regular room seemed rather tight. It would have been better if that room had 1 king-sized bed.
reviews.title: Not Bad !

likes.disliked: — Noisy in some rooms, need to do minor repairs in bathrooms

reviews.text: The first morning of our stay we were awakened at 6:15 AM by a duck having a quacking frenzy on our patio. I got up and went outside to shoo it away! Thankfully, this was not repeated any other morning. We suspect it is duck mating season as we witnessed some duck biology in action.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!
Great Location But Dark, Dreary Rooms
reviews.text: We twice breakfasted at the hotel restaurant and the food was good, freshly prepared and reasonably priced - much better than other San Diego hotels.

reviews.title: Loved the atmosphere!
reviews.text: Overall our stay was very pleasant with a large, clean room in which everything worked, a nice pool/hot tub area, good restaurant and very pleasant staff. Yes, we would return to this hotel.
Totally enjoyed the stay. Great location, great breakfast at Blue Wave. Easy to get to. Easy to get to zoo.
reviews.title: Great views, comfy rooms, clean, quiet, go again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a couple of tiny things that could be improved in the room. But no big deal.
reviews.title: Great experience!

likes.disliked: — Shelter Island doesn't have a bustling nightlife

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, I have to say, I booked my room using an Entertainment book (---) and received 50% off my room. Maybe it wouldn't have been worth paying "full price," but the room was fabulous for half price.
reviews.title: Excellent location and views.

likes.disliked: — Book a room facing the marina

reviews.text: The Best Western Island Palms is in the process of renovating their rooms. I stayed in one that had obviously been renovated already. It was beautiful. I stayed in a King size marina view room. It was lovely waking up and sitting outside on the patio with a cup of coffee looking at the yachts.
reviews.title: Cannot beat the location

reviews.text: The hotel staff is friendly and pleasant, and they were more than happy to provide concierge service. The bartender was charming. The restaurant served up a fabulous breakfast. The room was cleaned impeccably every day.
reviews.title: Scenic views on the island

reviews.text: This hotel is nicely located and well kept. The service was fantastic all the way from the check-in, house cleaning, food service and check-out. Given the cost in comparison to the other nearby hotels, this is a thumbs up.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What you can expect:
reviews.title: Chilled out!

reviews.text: 1) Mostly clean rooms. I would say that the carpet is a bit dated and could be replaced, but the hotel staff does it best to keep the rooms clean.
reviews.title: Loved the Island Palms

likes.liked: — The scenary, large suite and breakfast.
likes.disliked: — There was not a elevator in the second building.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) Great location on the Marina.
reviews.title: NO NO NO

reviews.text: 3) Comfortable place to stay.
reviews.title: Filthy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We managed to get a Casa Del Mar suite at half price due to our Entertainment Card so we only paid $149 per night.
reviews.title: Had a really nice stay

reviews.text: We were arriving on an early flight from Australia and had requested an check in around lunchtime – we actually arrived at 11.30am and it was nice to find our room was ready for us.
reviews.title: wonderful stay

likes.liked: — It was beautiful and perfect for our group

reviews.text: We were not expecting the accommodation to be anything special and thought the suite might be slightly outdated. It was slightly better than we had hoped for. It was quite spacious with a separate bedroom and lounge/living area. It was very clean which made it seem less outdated than it was. The television was large and had an excellent variety of channels. The complimentary wireless internet was very handy to have.
reviews.title: Loved Island Palms

likes.liked: — Beautiful room, great room service, quiet, beautiful setting

reviews.text: The overall facilities were well kept and had a pleasant tropical feel. Shelter Island where it is located is a very quiet part of San Diego and is about 5 miles from downtown.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but the housekeeping...

reviews.text: The staff were all very courteous and a special mention to the shuttle bus driver who went out of his way to take us to Petco Park for the baseball on Fri night.
reviews.title: Relaxed Atmosphere

aka: Best Western Plus Island Palms Hotel And Marina
description: Located on San Diego's Shelter Island, the Island Palms Hotel and Marina is surrounded by the blue waters of San Diego Bay. Nestled among 6 acres of lush, tropical landscaping, this spectacular setting overlooks our private yacht marina and San Diego's largest yacht basin. Features and amenities include 227 beautifully-appointed guest rooms and suites, 2 heated waterfront pools and spas, waterfront restaurant and bar and over 6,300 square feet of water view meeting space.
